trans-unit.source: Indicates that all previously provided iconic bitmaps from a window, both thumbnails and peek representations, should be refreshed

seg-source.mrk: Indicates that all previously provided iconic bitmaps from a window, both thumbnails and peek representations, should be refreshed

target.mrk: Indicates that all previously provided iconic bitmaps from a window, both thumbnails and peek representations, should be refreshed

trans-unit.source: Handle to the window or tab whose bitmaps are being invalidated through this call.

seg-source.mrk: Handle to the window or tab whose bitmaps are being invalidated through this call.

target.mrk: Handle to the window or tab whose bitmaps are being invalidated through this call.

trans-unit.source: 0 and sets the @error flag to non-zero, @extended flag may contain the HRESULT error code.

seg-source.mrk: 0 and sets the @error flag to non-zero, @extended flag may contain the HRESULT error code.

target.mrk: 0 and sets the @error flag to non-zero, @extended flag may contain the HRESULT error code.

trans-unit.source: Calling this function causes the Desktop Window Manager (DWM) to invalidate its current bitmaps for the window and request new bitmaps from the window when they are next needed. _WinAPI_DwmInvalidateIconicBitmaps() should not be called frequently.

seg-source.mrk: Calling this function causes the Desktop Window Manager (DWM) to invalidate its current bitmaps for the window and request new bitmaps from the window when they are next needed.

target.mrk: Calling this function causes the Desktop Window Manager (DWM) to invalidate its current bitmaps for the window and request new bitmaps from the window when they are next needed.

trans-unit.source: Doing so can lead to poor performance as new bitmaps are created and retrieved.

seg-source.mrk: Doing so can lead to poor performance as new bitmaps are created and retrieved.

target.mrk: Doing so can lead to poor performance as new bitmaps are created and retrieved.
